# makeFunction(descriptor:completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Asynchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.

## Declaration

```swift
func makeFunction(descriptor: MTLFunctionDescriptor, completionHandler: @escaping ((any MTLFunction)?, (any Error)?) -> Void)
```

```swift
func makeFunction(descriptor: MTLFunctionDescriptor) async throws -> any MTLFunction
```

## Parameters

- **descriptor**: The description of the function object to create.
- **completionHandler**: A Swift closure or an Objective-C block that Metal calls after it creates the function.

## Creating shader function instances

- **makeFunction(name:)**: Creates an instance that represents a shader function in the library.
- **makeFunction(name:constantValues:completionHandler:)**: Asynchronously creates a specialized shader function.
- **makeFunction(name:constantValues:)**: Synchronously creates a specialized shader function.
- **makeFunction(descriptor:)**: Synchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.
